api.gbuild.component

Class GText

  • java.lang.Object
    • api.gbuild.component.GComponent
      • api.gbuild.component.GText

  • public class GText
extends GComponent

    Component defined with a text

    Processing language evironment does not include an explicit data type for texts, but it offers lots of functions that allows to define properties for texts that will be drawn. This class was designed in order to incorporate texts as a component that can be modified with the equivalent Processing functions

    This release does include the possibility to define the font for texts, but this will be implemented for future revisions.

    For more information about text, click here

    Author:
    David Parre√±o Barbuzano

      • setAlign

        public void setAlign(int talign)
        Specify the alignment of the text.

        Available values are LEFT, RIGHT, and CENTER, so the modification would not be done if the passed value is not one of these values

        For more information about text alignment, click here

        Parameters:
        talign - text alignment

      • setMode

        public void setMode(int tmode)
        Specify the mode of the text. Available values are MODEL and SHAPE

        Available values are MODEL and SHAPE, so the modification would not be done if the passed value is not one of these values

        For more information about text alignment, click here

        Parameters:
        tmode - text mode

      • dim

        public processing.core.PVector dim()
        Description copied from class: GComponent
        Return the dimension for component.

        In order to avoid problem for pointer reference, the vector returned would be a new instance of the attribute, since you cannot change the dimension unless you use setters

        Overrides:
        dim in class GComponent
        Returns:
        a new instance for dimension

      • draw

        public void draw()
        Description copied from class: GComponent
        Draw component on the screen

        This method would drawn the component taking into account all the customization done before.

        It is important to notice that component would not be drawn if visible state is not true.

        Specified by:
        draw in class GComponent
        See Also:
        GComponent.isVisible()
